sub_title: Student-Athlete at UC Berkeley aspiring to have a career in the public health field
summary:
Hi! I am Tabo Stekelenburg, a student-athlete on the Women’s Rowing Team at UC Berkeley majoring in Public Health. I am interested in public health and community health because I spent the first few years of my life in Zambia and came into contact with different levels of access to health care. This made me realize that healthcare disparities exist and how it was visible in Zambia. I want to put in the effort to make this world a better place for people that are not getting the same opportunities as I’m getting, which is the main reason I decided to major in public health. I considered going to medical school for a long time but concluded that I am more interested in putting effort into the bigger picture and system. This way I will be able to have a more significant influence and help more people. I am currently exploring career paths in public health and I am very excited for any opportunities. 
After finishing high school in Amsterdam with a cum laude diploma, I accepted an offer from the University of California, Berkeley to further pursue my academic and athletic career in The United States of America. Currently, I'm in my senior year, admitted to the Public Health major, while making 20-hour weeks of collegiate rowing. I went to the Under 23 World Rowing Championships for the Netherlands during the summer of 2021, made the first eight for Cal during the 2021 NCAA Rowing Championships, and attended the Henley Royal Regatta in 2022. Rowing taught me to combine a busy athletic lifestyle with the high pressure of studying at a top university like Berkeley, being efficient is necessary, and spending my time wisely makes me both a good rower and student.

education.field_of_study: double program (technical studies, health, and nature)

awards.title: 2023 Pac-12 Spring Academic Honor Roll
awards.description: Any student-athlete on his or her respective team roster with a cumulative grade-point average of 3.3 or above, and who has served at least one year in residence at the institution, is eligible for the recognition.

awards.title: Dean's Honors List
awards.description:
The Dean's Honors List recognizes outstanding academic achievement each fall and spring semester.
Finished my junior year spring semester with a 4.00 semester GPA, which is in the top 10% of L&S undergraduates.

awards.title: Big C Society Member - Varsity Letter Winner on the Cal Women’s Rowing Team (UC Berkeley)
awards.description: Varsity Letter winner on the Cal Women’s Rowing Team after racing at the 2021 NCAA championships in the varsity 8+. Those accepted into the Big C Society have had success at the highest level of University sport.

awards.title: Award for the best School Research Project
awards.description: This project is a research paper written in the last year of pre-university education. I won the award for the best paper of my graduating class with: "Research into the influence of certain physical characteristics on rowing performance."

awards.title: genomineerd voor de KNAW Onderwijsprijs in het profiel natuur&techniek
awards.description: Mijn begeleidend docent heeft mijn profielwerkstuk ingezonden voor de KNAW Onderwijsprijs. Uiteindelijk geëindigd in de top 10 van de genomineerden in het profiel natuur&techniek.

awards.title: Junior Indoor National Rowing Champion
awards.description: Won the junior indoor national rowing championships in The Netherlands.

profile_positions.description: During this internship, I am assisting Mary Nicolaou, a professor working at Amsterdam UMC, on a research project about red meat. Some of my responsibilities are: helping define a research question, doing a systematic review using PubMed, creating an extraction table, and doing a lot of literature reviews.

volunteer_experiences.description:
During my secondary/high school years I organized different charity events. 
Year 1 (2015): Amstelring: raising money for elderly homes and doing some volunteering in elderly homes in Amsterdam myself.
Year 2 (2016): Mama Cash: raised money for this company supporting women's education and rights in Nepal.
Year 3 (2017): Refugee work NL: we raised money for housing for refugees staying/arriving in The Netherlands, also additional care for these people.
Year 4 (2018): Connect by Music: playing music to raise money for refugees in Lesbos, Greece.
Year 5 (2019): Invest In Your City: developed an online platform to make it easier to reach out to local charities and donate.

I started getting involved in this voluntary project at the age of 13. The 'Barlaeus Journaal' is basically a group of students with interests in presenting/filming/movie editing and we would make episodes about events happening that were connected to our high school. In the beginning, I was mostly responsible for movie editing, but we also had biweekly meetings to discuss our next episode. The last two years I was asked to be the chairwoman/president and that gave me the responsibility of keeping everything running. I put extra effort into recruiting new people and coming up with new and creative ideas. I also presented the show myself. This opportunity brought me a lot of experiences, mostly movie editing, using Final Cut Pro, but also working with autocue and cameras. It taught me to direct a group of people and create a motivating workspace, where everyone was welcome.
